title: Tiffany Haddish and Billy Crystal share a laugh and some ice cream while filming Here Today
text:
They're know for making audiences laugh.

But Tiffany Haddish and Billy Crystal seemed to be each other's biggest fans as they laughed it up while filming scenes from Here Today in New York.

The 39-year-old comedian wore a long floral coat while grabbing a delicious ice cream cone with her legendary co-star, 71.

Good times: Tiffany Haddish and Billy Crystal seemed to be each other's biggest fans as they laughed it up while filming scenes from Here Today in New York

Tiffany was dressed to the nines wearing a sparkling silver hat to match her glittering blouse which featured delicate tassels along her waist.

Her long-sleeved black jacket hit just below her knees and was embroidered with intricate floral detailing.

She kept things simple on the bottom with a pair of black slacks and matching suede boots while filming in the middle of a city street.

Make em laugh: The 39-year-old comedian wore a long floral coat while grabbing a delicious ice cream cone with her legendary co-star, 71

Bold: Tiffany was dressed to the nines wearing a sparkling silver hat to match her glittering blouse which featured delicate tassels along her waist

Billy wore a heavy grey cardigan with a sweater vest and appeared to be in great spirits while joking with his co-star.

He rocked his signature newsboy cap and showed a bit of scruff on his face to match his shaggy salt-and-pepper hair.

In addition to writing the script, Crystal sits in the director's chair for the romantic comedy which also stars Penn Badgley.

Star power: Haddish catapulted to the spotlight starring in Girls Trip in 2017 and most recently began hosting Kids Say the Darndest Things

Chic: Her long-sleeved black jacket hit just below her knees and was embroidered with intricate floral detailing

Crystal portrays comedy writer Charlie Berns who befriends a street singer named Emma Payge (Haddish), according to IMDb.

'Together, they form an unlikely yet hilarious and touching friendship that kicks the generation gap aside and redefines the meaning of love and trust.'

Billy recently starred in Standing Up, Falling Down and will soon lend his voice to Disney's Monsters at Work.

Haddish catapulted to the spotlight starring in Girls Trip in 2017 and most recently began hosting Kids Say the Darndest Things.
